name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
query: (winlog.channel:Security AND event.code:4697 AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:/.*[Mm][Ss][Hh][Tt][Aa].*/ AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:/.*[Vv][Bb][Ss][Cc][Rr][Ii][Pp][Tt]\:[Cc][Rr][Ee][Aa][Tt][Ee][Oo][Bb][Jj][Ee][Cc][Tt].*/ AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:/.*\.[Rr][Uu][Nn].*/ AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:/.*[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww]\.[Cc][Ll][Oo][Ss][Ee].*/)
note: **Detection Rule without Regex for better understanding. Be careful, this way is case sensitive:**`(winlog.channel:Security AND event.code:4697 AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:*mshta* AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:*vbscript\:createobject* AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:*.run* AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName:*window.close*)`
